recipes.name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
steps: Boil pasta
Sauté garlic
Combine pasta with garlic oil
Garnish with parsley

recipes.name: Caprese Salad
steps: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella
Layer with basil
Drizzle oil and glaze

recipes.name: Pasta Carbonara
steps: Cook pasta
Fry pancetta with garlic
Mix eggs and cheese
Combine all with pasta

recipes.name: Bruschetta
steps: Toast baguette slices
Mix tomatoes with basil and garlic
Top baguette with tomato mixture

recipes.name: Frittata
steps: Beat eggs with cheese
Sautè vegetables
Combine eggs with vegetables, cook until set

recipes.name: Minestrone Soup
steps: Simmer broth with tomatoes
Add vegetables and pasta
Stir in beans until heated through

recipes.name: Tiramisu
steps: Dip ladyfingers in espresso
Layer with mascarpone
Chill, then dust with cocoa

recipes.name: Risotto
steps: Sautè onion
Toast rice, deglaze with wine
Add stock gradually, stir until creamy

recipes.name: Polenta
steps: Boil water
Whisk in cornmeal gradually
Cook until thickened, stir in butter and cheese

recipes.name: Pesto Pasta
steps: Cook pasta
Mix pasta with pesto
Garnish with Parmesan and pine nuts

recipes.name: Quiche Lorraine
steps: Pre-bake the pie crust until lightly golden
Whisk together eggs, cream, chopped bacon, and grated Gruyère, then pour into the crust
Bake until the filling is set and the top is golden brown

recipes.name: Ratatouille
steps: Sautè sliced eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomato in olive oil until tender
Layer the cooked vegetables in a baking dish, seasoning with garlic and herbs between layers
Bake in the oven until the flavors meld and the top is slightly caramelized

recipes.name: Croque Monsieur
steps: Spread Dijon mustard on bread slices, then layer with ham and grated Gruyère. Top with another slice of bread
Melt butter in a pan and toast the sandwiches until golden brown on both sides
Top each sandwich with more Gruyère and broil until the cheese is bubbly and golden

recipes.name: Salade Nièoise
steps: Arrange lettuce, halved tomatoes, halved hard-boiled eggs, Nièoise olives, and anchovies on a plate
Top with flaked tuna and drizzle with olive oil and vinegar dressing
Season with salt and pepper to taste

recipes.name: French Onion Soup
steps: Caramelize sliced onions in butter, then add beef stock and simmer for depth of flavor
Pour the soup into oven-safe bowls, top with a slice of toasted French bread and grated Gruyère cheese
Broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly

recipes.name: Crèpes
steps: Mix flour, milk, eggs, melted butter, and salt to create a smooth batter
Pour a small amount of batter into a hot, lightly buttered pan, tilting to spread evenly
Cook until edges are dry, flip carefully, and cook the other side. Fill as desired

recipes.name: Beef bourguignon
steps: Brown chunks of beef, then sautè carrots and onions in the same pot
Add red wine and beef stock to the pot, along with herbs, and simmer until the beef is tender
Serve with boiled potatoes or crusty bread

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
steps: Brown chicken pieces and lardons. Remove and sautè mushrooms and onions in the same pan
Return the chicken to the pan, add red wine and chicken stock, and simmer until the chicken is cooked through
Thicken the sauce if desired, and serve with mashed potatoes

recipes.name: Tarte Tatin
steps: Caramelize sugar and butter in a pan, then arrange apple slices on top
Cover apples with puff pastry, tucking in the edges, and bake until golden
Cool slightly, then invert onto a plate before serving

recipes.name: Moules Marinières
steps: Sautè finely chopped shallots and garlic in butter, then add mussels and pour over white wine
Cover and steam until the mussels open, then sprinkle with chopped parsley
Serve with the cooking liquid and fresh bread or fries

recipes.name: Karaage
steps: Cut chicken into bite sized pieces
Mix everything together but the Potato starch and chicken
Put chicken into marinade overnight
Take chicken out of marinade
Add potato starch into bowl and add in a tiny splash of  water
Toss potato starch around in bowl to form small tiny clumps
Put chicken into potato starch until coated completely
Fry in oil, after frying it to golden brown, take all of it out, and fry again for about 20 seconds

recipes.name: Chicken Katsu
steps: Pound chicken breasts to even thickness, about 1/2 inch, then season both sides with salt and pepper.
Prepare three shallow dishes: one with flour, one with beaten eggs and water mixed together, and one with panko breadcrumbs.
Dredge each chicken piece in flour, shaking off the excess, then dip into the egg mixture, and finally coat thoroughly with panko breadcrumbs.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add chicken pieces and cook until golden brown and crispy, about 3 to 4 minutes per side.
Transfer cooked chicken to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Serve hot, sliced with tonkatsu sauce on the side for dipping.

recipes.name: Katsudon
steps: Slice the cooked Chicken Katsu into strips.
In a skillet, combine dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Bring to a simmer.
Add sliced onions to the skillet and cook until tender.
Place Chicken Katsu strips over the onions. Beat eggs and pour over the chicken and onions.
Cover and cook over low heat until the egg is just set.
Serve the chicken and egg mixture over bowls of cooked rice.

recipes.name: Japanese Chicken Curry
steps: Cut the chicken, carrots, onions, and potatoes into bite-sized pieces.
In a large pot, sauté onions until translucent, then add chicken and brown slightly.
Add carrots and potatoes to the pot, then add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer.
Add the curry roux blocks to the pot, stirring until fully dissolved. Simmer until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened.
Serve the curry over bowls of cooked rice.

recipes.name: Gyudon
steps: In a large skillet, combine the dashi, soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar. Bring to a simmer.
Add the sliced onions to the skillet and cook until tender.
Add the thinly sliced beef to the skillet and cook until browned.
Divide the cooked rice among four bowls. Top each bowl with the beef and onion mixture.
Garnish with pickled red ginger.

recipes.name: Japanese Cold Soba
steps: Cook soba noodles in boiling water until just tender, then rinse under cold water and drain.
Combine soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and dashi stock in a bowl to make the dipping sauce.
Chill the cooked soba noodles and dipping sauce in the refrigerator until cold.
Serve the cold soba noodles on plates with the dipping sauce on the side.
Garnish the noodles with chopped green onions, wasabi, and nori strips.

recipes.name: Japanese Udon Soup
steps: Cook udon noodles according to package instructions, then rinse under cold water and drain.
In a large pot, combine dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Bring to a simmer.
Add shiitake mushrooms to the pot and cook until tender.
Divide the cooked noodles among four bowls.
Pour the hot soup over the noodles in each bowl.
Top with spinach, green onions, kamaboko slices, and optional tempura bits.

recipes.name: Oyakodon
steps: Cut the chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces.
In a skillet, combine the dashi, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Bring to a simmer.
Add the sliced onions to the skillet and cook until tender.
Add the chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until done.
Beat the eggs lightly, then pour over the chicken and onions in the skillet. Cover and cook until the eggs are just set.
Serve the chicken and egg mixture over bowls of cooked rice, garnished with green onions.

recipes.name: Onigiri with Unagi Filling
steps: Season the cooked rice with salt, and let it cool until it's comfortable to handle.
Cut the pre-cooked unagi into small pieces and mix with soy sauce and mirin.
Wet your hands to prevent the rice from sticking, then take a portion of rice and form a small well in the center.
Place a piece of the seasoned unagi in the well, then mold the rice around it to form a ball or a triangle.
Wrap the rice ball with a strip of nori seaweed for easy handling and added flavor.
Repeat the process until all the rice and unagi are used.

recipes.name: Miso Soup
steps: Soak the dried wakame in water for about 5 minutes, then drain.
Bring the dashi stock to a simmer in a pot.
Place a small amount of the hot dashi into a bowl with the miso paste. Whisk until smooth, then add back into the pot of dashi.
Add the tofu and wakame to the pot and heat through, being careful not to boil the soup after adding the miso.
Serve in bowls, garnished with green onions.

recipes.name: Potstickers with Crispy Skirt
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Arrange the potstickers in the skillet and cook until the bottoms start to brown.
Mix water and flour in a bowl to create a slurry, then pour this mixture into the skillet around the potstickers.
Cover the skillet with a lid and cook until the water has evaporated and the flour forms a crispy skirt around the potstickers.
Remove the lid, let the crust cook a little more until it's golden brown, then carefully remove everything from the skillet, keeping the crispy skirt intact.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Taiwanese Popcorn Chicken
steps: Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces and marinate with soy sauce, rice wine, sugar, five-spice powder, white pepper, and garlic powder for at least 30 minutes.
Beat the egg and mix into the chicken.
Combine cornstarch and sweet potato flour in a separate bowl.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or deep skillet.
Dredge the marinated chicken pieces in the flour mixture, then fry until golden brown and crispy.
In the same oil, quickly fry the basil leaves until crispy.
Serve the popcorn chicken garnished with the crispy basil leaves.

recipes.name: Stir-Fry Egg and Tomatoes
steps: Beat the eggs with half the salt and set aside.
Heat one tablespoon of oil in a pan over medium heat, scramble the eggs until just set, then remove them from the pan.
Add the remaining oil to the pan, and stir-fry the tomatoes with the remaining salt and sugar until they start to soften.
Return the scrambled eggs to the pan, add the green onions, and stir well to combine. Cook for an additional minute.
Serve hot as a side dish or over rice for a simple meal.

recipes.name: Taiwanese Fried XXL Chicken
steps: Pound the chicken breast to an even thickness, then cut into a large, thin piece similar to a schnitzel.
Marinate the chicken with soy sauce, rice wine, garlic powder, five-spice powder, white pepper, sugar, and salt for at least 30 minutes.
Beat the egg and mix it into the chicken.
Dredge the marinated chicken in sweet potato starch, ensuring it's fully coated.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or deep skillet to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the chicken until golden brown and crispy, about 5 to 7 minutes, depending on the thickness.
Let the chicken drain on paper towels, then cut into strips and serve hot.

recipes.name: Taiwanese Fried Pork Chop
steps: Tenderize the pork chops to about 1/4 inch thickness, then cut into serving pieces.
Create a marinade by mixing soy sauce, rice wine, minced garlic, five-spice powder, white pepper, and sugar. Marinate the pork chops in this mixture for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight.
Beat the egg and lightly coat each marinated pork chop with it.
Dredge the egg-coated pork chops in sweet potato starch, making sure each piece is fully coated.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or deep skillet to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the pork chops until golden brown and crispy, about 3 to 5 minutes on each side, depending on thickness.
Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil before serving.

recipes.name: Stinky Tofu
steps: Cut the stinky tofu into bite-sized pieces.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or deep skillet to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the stinky tofu pieces until they are golden brown and crispy, about 5 minutes.
Drain the fried tofu on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Serve hot with soy sauce, chili sauce, and pickled cabbage on the side for dipping.

recipes.name: Taiwanese Stir Fry Cabbage
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add the sliced cabbage to the pan. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, or until cabbage is tender but still slightly crisp.
Stir in soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Drizzle with sesame oil before removing from heat.
Serve hot as a side dish or part of a larger meal.

recipes.name: Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup
steps: Blanch the beef shank and bones in boiling water for 5 minutes to remove impurities. Drain and rinse.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add ginger, green onions, garlic, star anise, and dried chili pepper. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Add the blanched beef shank, bones, and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 hours.
Add soy sauce, dark soy sauce, rice wine, rock sugar, and Chinese five spice. Continue to simmer for another hour.
Cook noodles according to package instructions. Blanch bok choy in boiling water.
Slice the beef shank. Place noodles and bok choy in bowls, add sliced beef, and ladle hot broth over. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Oyster Vermicelli Noodles
steps: Soak the vermicelli noodles in warm water for about 10 minutes, then drain.
Mix cornstarch with water to create a slurry. Set aside.
Heat a pot over medium heat, add a bit of oil, and sauté ginger and garlic until fragrant.
Add the chicken stock to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Add the oysters to the simmering broth and cook until the edges start to curl.
Add the soy sauce, black vinegar, and the cornstarch slurry to the pot, stirring until the broth thickens slightly.
Add the drained vermicelli noodles to the pot and cook until tender, about 2 minutes.
Stir in sesame oil, then remove from heat.
Serve the oyster vermicelli in bowls, garnished with green onions and cilantro.

recipes.name: Scallion Pancakes with Eggs
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Place one frozen scallion pancake in the skillet and cook until golden brown on one side, about 2 minutes.
Flip the pancake. Crack an egg over the pancake, spreading the egg white gently to cover most of the pancake while keeping the yolk intact.
Cover the skillet with a lid and cook until the egg white is set but the yolk is still runny, about 2-3 minutes.
Repeat the process for the remaining pancakes and eggs.
Serve hot, drizzled with soy sauce and optional hot sauce, garnished with chopped scallions.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
steps: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, lemon juice, turmeric, half the garam masala, cumin, paprika, and salt for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Grill the marinated chicken until fully cooked. Set aside.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and ginger, sautéing until onions are soft.
Add the remaining garam masala and tomato puree to the pan, simmering for 10 minutes.
Add the grilled chicken pieces to the sauce, cover, and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Stir in the cream, simmering gently for 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes, then immerse in cold water. Drain and puree the spinach.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds. When they start to crackle, add garlic, ginger, and green chili. Sauté for a minute.
Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent. Add the chopped tomato, turmeric, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the spinach puree to the pan. Cook for 5-7 minutes, then add the paneer cubes. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in the cream and garam masala. Adjust salt if necessary and cook for another minute.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Chole (Chickpea Curry)
steps: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates from the masala.
Add the soaked chickpeas and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer until the chickpeas are tender, about 1 hour.
Stir in garam masala and amchur powder. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or flatbreads.

recipes.name: Rogan Josh
steps: Marinate the lamb pieces in yogurt, half of the garam masala, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and Kashmiri chili powder for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Heat oil in a large pot. Add cinnamon, cardamom, and bay leaves. Sauté for a minute.
Add onions and cook until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger, and sauté until fragrant.
Add the marinated lamb along with the marinade to the pot. Brown the lamb on all sides.
Add tomato puree and salt. Stir well and cook for a few minutes until the oil begins to separate from the sauce.
Add water, cover, and simmer on low heat for about 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the lamb is tender.
Stir in the remaining garam masala and adjust seasoning if necessary. Cook uncovered for an additional 10 minutes to thicken the sauce.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Masoor Dal
steps: Rinse the red lentils until the water runs clear. Add lentils to a pot with water, turmeric, and salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer until lentils are tender, about 20-25 minutes.
In a separate pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add cumin and mustard seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add the chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili. Sauté until the onions are golden.
Stir in the chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add the cooked tomato mixture to the cooked lentils. Stir in garam masala and adjust seasoning.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or flatbread.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate the chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, half the garam masala, ginger garlic paste, and salt for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat, add the marinated chicken, and cook until browned on all sides. Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same pan, melt the butter, then add the tomato puree and cook for a few minutes. Add the remaining garam masala and simmer for 10 minutes.
Return the chicken to the pan with the tomato mixture. Add honey and simmer until the chicken is fully cooked.
Stir in the heavy cream and kasuri methi, cook for an additional 5 minutes. Adjust seasoning with salt.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add the potatoes and cauliflower florets. Stir to coat with oil and spices.
Sprinkle turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt over the vegetables. Stir well.
Add ginger, garlic, and green chili. Mix well and cook for a minute.
Stir in the chopped tomato and water. Cover and cook over medium-low heat until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Uncover, increase heat to medium-high, and cook for a few more minutes to evaporate any excess liquid.
Sprinkle garam masala over the vegetables. Turn off the heat and cover the pan for a few minutes to let the flavors meld.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving. Serve hot with roti or rice.

recipes.name: Naan
steps: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let it sit for 10 minutes until frothy.
In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, and baking powder. Add the yeast mixture, yogurt, and oil, and knead into a soft dough.
Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and divide it into 8 equal parts. Roll each part into a ball, then flatten and stretch into an oval shape.
Preheat a skillet or griddle over high heat. Cook each naan until it puffs up and has golden brown spots on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
Brush the naan with melted butter, sprinkle with minced garlic and cilantro if using, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Biryani
steps: Wash and soak the basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain.
Marinate the chicken with yogurt, half of the biryani masala, turmeric, ginger garlic paste, salt, and half of the mint and cilantro leaves for at least 1 hour.
Fry onions in oil until golden brown. Remove half for garnishing.
In the same pan, add the marinated chicken, cook until the chicken is three-quarters done.
Boil water in a large pot, add the soaked rice, and cook until it's 70% cooked. Drain the rice.
Layer the cooked chicken and cooked rice in a pot. Sprinkle the saffron milk, remaining biryani masala, mint, cilantro, fried onions, lemon juice, and dots of ghee over the rice.
Cover and cook on a low flame for 20 minutes or until done.
Serve hot, garnished with the reserved fried onions.

recipes.name: Samosa
steps: To make the dough, mix the flour, ajwain, salt, and oil. Gradually add water to form a stiff dough. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.
For the filling, heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, ginger, and green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add the mashed potatoes, green peas, garam masala, coriander powder, amchur, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes, then add fresh coriander. Let it cool.
Divide the dough into balls, roll each into a thin oval, cut it in half, and form each piece into a cone. Fill with the potato mixture, seal the edges with water.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or pan. Fry the samosas in batches until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.
